info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 19 at 10:05AM CDT until March 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Twin Cities/Chanhassen MN
info.description:
...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS EXPECTED ALONG THE I-90 CORRIDOR THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON...
.HEAVIEST SNOW CONTINUES SHIFTING SOUTH WITH WINTER STORM...
.The narrow band of heavier snow has shifted south, and the gradient has tightened up. As a result, areas across Minnesota and west central Wisconsin will see less snow, warnings and advisories have shifted south as well.
The greatest risk area remains along I-90 as this is the most likely area to have the overlap between snow falling at high enough rates and the high winds for blizzard conditions.
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.
* WHERE...Eau Claire County.
* WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Call 5 1 1 or visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED
